column4: DerHeks: How do you run cheese to take a single picture? I cant seem to find the man pages for command line arguments?
lol
I am looking for a command that I can execute that will take a single picture from my webcam, BUT I want it to prompt the user with a preview so they can be sure its in frame... help!?
DerHeks: No I want to take 1 and only one pic, but I only want it taken when the persons face is in frame, not 1/2 off the screen
DerHeks: Make sense?
streamer -f jpeg -o /path/to/image.jpeg then script it to show you the image and do what you want
No streamer takes a picture immediatly, so the person Im taking a pic of is probably 1/2 out of frame, is there a way to get it to wait till the person is in frame?
There is no program to do that. You just have to take the pic, open it to view it and decide if its acceptable then delete and repeat if not etc
You need to write a script to suit your needs
take pic, open it to view, if acceptable, enter y, else enter n and have it delete the image and start at step one
You are making this way more difficult than what it is
There are a plethora of tools and ways to do this. Get creative.
OK simplify it for me... please :-)
In one word? Cheese.
OK how do I know when the picture was taken with cheese?
You will have to try it and find out for yourself
ok so you are giving me advice about something you really do not know about,... thanks :-(
The point is that you need to try things and figure it out. My do a web search with google about exactly what you want
Obviously, and I did that, I would not waste your time on something I did not try and research first
You arent the first one to use a webcam on linux
obviously, and I dont appreciate being talked down to
